field.label: NextDNS CLI Enabled
field.help: Enable or disable Nextdns CLI; NextDNS CLI is not required to route requests towards NextDNS internet service.

field.label: NextDNS email
field.help: Email registered on nextdns.com - used to get/post settings, query logs and create whitelists/blacklsits

field.label: Configuration IDs (semicolon-separated)
field.help: Comma-separated field; NextDNS allows multiple ids, each one to be prefixed with a condition that is match for each query * 10.0.3.0/24=abcdef: A CIDR can be used to restrict a configuration to a subnet. * 00:1c:42:2e:60:4a=abcdef: A MAC address can be used to restrict configuration to a specific host on the LAN.

field.label: Auto Activate
field.help: NextDNS will run activate at startup and deactivate on exit.

field.label: Auto-setup router
field.help: Automatically configure NextDNS for a router setup. Common types of router are detected to integrate gracefuly. Changes applies are undone on daemon exit. The listen option is ignored when this option is used.

field.label: Listening [ip]:port (semicolon-separated)
field.help: Listen address for UDP DNS proxy server. This option is ignored if Auto-setup router is selected. Can be just the port (:53), ip:port (192.168.1.1:53) or host:port (localhost:53)

field.label: DNS forward for a specified domain (semicolon-separated)
field.help: Forwarders can be defined to send proxy DNS traffic to an alternative DNS upstream resolver for specific domains. The format of this parameter is [DOMAIN=]SERVER_ADDR. Can ben either an IP[:PORT] for DNS53 (unencrypted UDP, TCP), or a HTTPS URL for a DNS over HTTPS server. For DoH, a bootstrap IP can be specified as follow: https://dns.nextdns.io#45.90.28.0. Several servers can be specified, separated by comas to implement failover: mycompany.com=1.2.3.4,1.2.3.5; mycompany2.com=https://doh.mycompany.com/dns-query#1.2.3.4

field.label: Nextdns cache size (in MB)
field.help: Set the size of the cache in byte. Use 0 to disable caching. The value can be expressed with unit like kB, MB, GB. The cache is automatically flushed when the pointed configuration is updated. (default "0")

field.label: cache-max-age duration (in sec)
field.help: If set to greater than 0, a cached entry will be considered stale after this duration, even if the record's TTL is higher.

field.label: Max time-to-live duration (in sec)
field.help: If set to greater than 0, defines the maximum TTL value that will be handed out to clients. The specified maximum TTL will be given to clients instead of the true TTL value if it is lower. The true TTL value is however kept in the cache to evaluate cache entries freshness. This is best used in conjunction with the cache to force clients not to rely on their own cache in order to pick up configuration changes faster.

field.label: Query timeout (in sec)
field.help: Maximum duration allowed for a request before failing. Default: 5s

field.label: Detect captive portals
field.help: Automatic detection of captive portals and fallback on system DNS to allow the connection to establish.Beware that enabling this feature can allow an attacker to force nextdns to disable DoH and leak unencrypted DNS traffic.

field.label: Bogus private reverse lookups
field.help: All reverse lookups for private IP ranges (ie 192.168.x.x, etc.) are answered with "no such domain" rather than being forwarded upstream. The set of prefixes affected is the list given in RFC6303.

field.label: Report client info
field.help: NextDNS will attempt to embed clients information with queries.

field.label: Discovery DNS
field.help: The address of a DNS server to be used to discover client names. If not defined, the address learned via DHCP will be used. This setting is only active if report-client-info is set to true.
